Sentencas: The triode solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is a three electrodes configuration.
Titulo: Triode Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operation Under Sulfur-Poisoning Conditions

Sentencas: The third electrode, so-called auxiliary, is connected in a way to run in electrolysis mode, while cathode and anode operate in normal fuel cell mode.
Titulo: Triode Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operation Under Sulfur-Poisoning Conditions

Sentencas: This mixed operation allows to reach anode-cathode potential differences which are not accessible in normal operation.
Titulo: Triode Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operation Under Sulfur-Poisoning Conditions

Sentencas: In this work, the benefits of triode operation under sulfur-poisoning conditions are shown.
Titulo: Triode Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operation Under Sulfur-Poisoning Conditions

Sentencas: In particular, the difference between conventional and triode operation mode under 2ppm of H2S in H-2 are analyzed.
Titulo: Triode Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operation Under Sulfur-Poisoning Conditions

Sentencas: The partial reversibility of sulfur poisoning is investigated and the observed regeneration processes are discussed for both the conventional and triode operation.
Titulo: Triode Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operation Under Sulfur-Poisoning Conditions

Sentencas: After each sequence of exposure and regeneration, IV and EIS characteristics are taken.
Titulo: Triode Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operation Under Sulfur-Poisoning Conditions

Sentencas: The electrochemical impedance spectra are further processed by computing the distribution of relaxation times (DRT).
Titulo: Triode Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operation Under Sulfur-Poisoning Conditions

Sentencas: During triode operation, less degradation during exposure and faster stabilization after exposure and regeneration with respect to conventional operation mode are observed.
Titulo: Triode Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Operation Under Sulfur-Poisoning Conditions
